revised_title: Regeneration of Nerves: A Study of Neurilemmal Cells and Nerve Fibers
tldr: This article discusses the process of nerve regeneration and the role of neurilemmal cells in the formation of new nerve fibers. The authors argue that the axis cylinder, the essential part of a nerve fiber, has an exclusively central origin, challenging the idea that new nerve fibers have a peripheral origin. They also explore the nutritive function of the nerve sheath and its relationship to nerve regeneration.
